com.jamejam.api.types

Class ReplyKeyboardMarkup.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jamejam.api.types.ReplyKeyboardMarkup.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    ReplyKeyboardMarkup

    public static class ReplyKeyboardMarkup.Builder
extends Object
    A convenience Builder for this class. An example: 
     ReplyKeyboardMarkup markup = new ReplyKeyboardMarkup.Builder()
                                          .row("A", "B", "C")
                                          .row("D")
                                          .row("E", "F")
                                          .build();

    • Method Detail

      • row

        public ReplyKeyboardMarkup.Builder row(String... buttons)
        Adds a row of "buttons" to the keyboard.
        Parameters:
        buttons - the row of buttons, represented as a String array.
        Returns:
        This Builder instance, to allow method chaining.

      • add

        public ReplyKeyboardMarkup.Builder add(int width,
                              String... buttons)
        Adds all buttons with a maximum width per row.
        Parameters:
        width - The maximum amount of buttons per row.
        buttons - The buttons to add.
        Returns:
        This Builder instance, to allow method chaining.

      • setResizeKeyboard

        public ReplyKeyboardMarkup.Builder setResizeKeyboard()
        Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.
        Returns:
        This Builder instance, to allow method chaining.

      • setOneTimeKeyboard

        public ReplyKeyboardMarkup.Builder setOneTimeKeyboard()
        Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. Defaults to false.
        Returns:
        This Builder instance, to allow method chaining.

      • setSelective

        public ReplyKeyboardMarkup.Builder setSelective()
        Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message. Example: A user requests to change the bot‘s language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don’t see the keyboard.
        Returns:
        This Builder instance, to allow method chaining.

      • build

        public ReplyKeyboardMarkup build()
        Builds the ReplyKeyboardMarkup object.
        Returns:
        The freshly created ReplyKeyboardMarkup
